reviews.text: We went as a party of 5 - the Grand Canyon tour was very special - staggering scenery you could just stand and admire all day - such a range of colours as the light changed. Very polite and helpful staff. The cowboys were very funny and the horses very beautiful. The restaurant meal at the village was a surprise - very tender ribs and a good sized meal. I dont know why mash potato must always be peppered in the US - to me it doesnt add anything.
reviews.title: Very good food - a fun place

reviews.text: We planned to arrive at Grand Canyon West in the late afternoon and did not want to drive the desert roads (and dirt road) after dark so we bought the tranquility package to stay at the Hualapai Ranch.
reviews.title: Only hotel on Grand Canyon West premises

reviews.text: It was definitely worth it for the following reasons - we were some of the few people still at Grand Canyon West after 6 PM and we were able to see the sunset at Guana Point -a truly awesome experience. We then went to the ranch where we found there were no keys - they are in the room and since it was late we needed to go to the 'dance hall' to eat before it closed. Dinner and breakfast are included with the package (129 per person - room, meals, access to Grand Canyon West but not skywalk). The meal was adequate and there was a large group of Japanese tourists singing Karioke in the dining hall - we think there is a large overnight tourist destination.
reviews.title: Skip Skywalk and Skip Hualapai Ranch

reviews.text: The 'cowboy' helped us to our cabin which was the last one at the very end of rows of cabins.
reviews.title: Know what to expect and you will have an awesome time!

reviews.text: It was clean, had 3 twin beds and a bathroom. It was better than camping and adequate but for anyone who won't stay at a day's inn this is not for you. Remember this is in the middle of a desert with no power lines (generators supply power) and on an Indian reservation where the only lodging is this ranch.
reviews.title: Cowboy Shambles – Better organisation definitely required!

reviews.text: Our night at the ranch was great, Swiss-Italians loved it! Personnel and facilities at the Ranch were exceptional. However, as the American family member who organized our adventure it was equally frustrating. i sent a lengthy email to both the Operations and Marketing Mangers detailing all the issues i faced, including double billing on the credit card that took 3 phone calls, 2 emails, and then a face to face confrontation before being resolved. And I have not had the courtesy of a response from either.
reviews.title: Ranch 10, Hualapai Indian Service 0

reviews.text: If you want an overnight stay, and i do recommend doing so, i suggest you call them, make them explain fully what you are entitled to in each of the too many and overlapping packages they offer. DO NOT MAKE YOUR RESERVATIONS THROUGH THEIR WEB PORTAL--IT IS VERY CONFUSING AND HAS NO PROCESSES BEHIND IT TO HANDLE SEAMLESSLY YOUR RESERVATION!
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where do I begin. It was an awesome experience. We arrived at this Ranch on July 31st to stay one night. The road to the Grand Canyon west rim was unpaved for about 20 miles but the drive was exciting. Suggest that you rent a car for this trip. Arrived at the ranch and was greeted by a person named Patrick. He was very accomodating and informed us what we should do and where we should go to obtain tickets to register at this place. Although we did not have the pre-registration tickets, he did give the cottage keys and allowed us to drive directly to the cottage to unload our luggage. Following that we visited the skywalk and Guano Point. Returned to the ranch to have dinner. There was a 'one man' band and the songs he played was lovely, while we had dinner which consisted of either ribs or chicken (bbq) & 2 sides with a chocolate chip cookie. Although the cafetaria board indicates that we have to select two of the 6 sides, they gave us a little of everything. It was just a matter of asking the servers and they were quite accommodating. There were unlimited soft drinks/coffee/tea/hot chocolate etc. The cafetaria is open for unlimited drinks/water 24/7 (which is included in your price) which was great during the time we visted as the weather was hot. Also there was a magician named Chris Magic to entertain you. We did a lot of dancing and learn a few line dancing steps as well.
reviews.title: Awesome Experience

reviews.text: We woke up early, the next day to see the 'day light' and sunrise which was spectacular from the front porch of your cottage. There are horse driven wagon rides (free) and many other things for you to do (throwing the hatchet; bow/arrow; horseshoe throw etc.) Horseback riding is available for a fee. We felt like cowboys and experienced on how they live. My kids did not want to leave this place. It was a true awesome experience. Check out their website http://www.hualapaitourism.com/
reviews.title: A great night out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is a country within USA. It was a new knowledge to me that there are independent places controlled by (red) Indians within USA where taxes, ownership etc is with the Indians.
reviews.title: Superb Experience at One of the Natural Wonders

reviews.text: This ranch is just at the edge of the Grand Canyon West. Although we were told that we will find lots of (red) Indians but we could find hardly 2-3 Indians in the ranch rest others were of different nationalities working there. However, the place is excellent.
reviews.title: An absolute highlight of our US vacation!

reviews.text: We reached there in the afternoon and stayed there till next morning around 10 AM. We saw the Grand Canyon in the full glory when the Sun was on the top, when Sun was setting and then when it was rising.
reviews.title: Fun experience on a desert ranch!

reviews.text: There is a dining room which is open 24 hours. Although in the night one can have only limited items.
reviews.title: This was the best part of our 5 week holiday around the U.S.

reviews.text: Dinner and Breakfast is provided at the Ranch. Enough options for vegetarians.
reviews.title: Over Rated Budget Accommodation
